406b.text: MOVEXY operates very similarly to MOVE except that the destination is an x,y coordinate rather than a holder. You should also review the MOVE tutorial. As of when this tutorial was prepared, collections are not supported (but plans are in the works).

bm4j.text: The button above moves one card at a time to x,y coordinates below. This face up deck of spade cards is in order from 2 to ace with the ace on bottom. It deals from the top of deck and each card is stacked on top of the other one so the 2 ends up on the 'bottom' (lowest z value). Cards moved to the same coordinates using MOVEXY will form piles.

bm5j.text: The button above moves a packet of 7 cards to x,y coordinates below. This face up deck of hearts is in order from 2 to ace, with the ace on bottom. The button collects a packet of 7 cards and moves the entire packet as is to the coordinates. Although the cards appear to be in the holder, they are not actually children of the holder.

bm6j.text: This button moves all the cards to x,y coordinates to the right of the holder. There is no setting for 'all' cards, so use 0 (or a high count value, such as 999) to ensure they are all moved. This also sets the the cards to be face up using the 'face' parameter. Note that the pile is not flipped as you would with a physical deck. The order of the cards is unchanged. They are each turned face up and remain in the same order.

bm7j.text: This button moves one widget at a time to the default coordinates if no x or y is specified (0,0). It moves the widget with the higest 'z' value (equivalent to the top of a deck).

bm8j.text: This button moves one card from the 52 card deck and creates a face-up spread out stack by incrementing the x coordinate after each card. The Recall & Shuffle button resets the starting position.
